definitions.definition: To rotate , revolve , spin or turn rapidly .
examples: The dancer whirled across the stage, stopped, and whirled around to face the audience.

definitions.definition: To have a sensation of spinning or reeling .
examples: My head is whirling after all that drink.

definitions.definition: To make something or someone whirl.
examples: The dancer whirled his partner round on her toes.

definitions.definition: To remove or carry quickly with, or as with, a revolving motion; to snatch.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To rotate , revolve , spin or turn rapidly .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To have a sensation of spinning or reeling .
( transitive ) To make something or someone whirl.
( transitive ) To remove or carry quickly with, or as with, a revolving motion; to snatch.
